data.question: What is the empirical formula of MTAF-4?
At what temperature was the mixture for MTAF-4 synthesis heated?
What is the yield percentage of MTAF-4 based on the tab ligand?
What is the BET surface area of MTAF-4?
What is the maximum CO2 adsorption capacity of MTAF-4 at 300 K and 30 bar?
What is the crystal system of MTAF-4?
What is the role of the 1,2,3-triazolate donor group in the formation of MTAF-4?
data.answer: It favors the formation of highly connected multinuclear metal clusters.

data.question: Why does MTAF-4 have a high CO2 adsorption capacity?
data.answer: Due to the existence of uncoordinated nitrogen atoms of 1,2,3-triazole groups that serve as Lewis base sites.

data.question: How does the presence of both 1,2,3-triazolate and carboxylate donor groups in the tab ligand contribute to the structure of MTAF-4?
data.answer: They facilitate the in situ generation of multinuclear metal clusters as highly bridged nodes.

data.question: What is the significance of the (6,9)-connected topology in MTAF-4?
data.answer: It contributes to the framework robustness and remarkable surface area of MTAF-4.

data.question: How does the structure of MTAF-4 affect its gas adsorption properties?
data.answer: The structure provides permanent porosity, allowing for the adsorption of CO2, H2, and CH4 under high pressures.

data.question: What is the role of the heptanuclear zinc cluster in MTAF-4?
data.answer: It serves as a 9-connected node, contributing to the highly connected structure of MTAF-4.

data.question: Is the BET surface area of MTAF-4 higher than 1500 m2 g^-1?
Is MTAF-4 synthesized at a temperature below 100 oC?
Does MTAF-4 have a cubic crystal system?
Can MTAF-4 adsorb CO2 at room temperature?
Is the yield of MTAF-4 based on the tab ligand over 80%?
Does MTAF-4 have a BET surface area lower than 1000 m2 g^-1?
Is the high-pressure CO2 adsorption capacity of MTAF-4 at room temperature lower than that of conventional zeolites?
Does the presence of uncoordinated nitrogen atoms in MTAF-4 decrease its CO2 adsorption capacity?
